definition[0]: the work of explaining to the public what an organization does, so that they will understand it and approve of it
example[0]: They ran their own successful public relations business in London.
definition[1]: the relationship between an organization and the public
example[1]: The project has been disastrous for the bank in terms of public relations.
example[2]: a public relations exercise  (=done in order to improve the relationship between the public and an organization)
explanation[0]: In meaning 1, public relations is followed by a singular verb
example[3]: Public relations is an interesting field to work in
explanation[1]: In meaning 2, public relations is followed by a plural verb
example[4]: Our public relations are handled by Lisa Holden
example[5]: They hired a public relations company.
example[6]: We decided to launch a public-relations campaign, including newspaper ads and subway posters.
